adr_address: 4 Rue du Mont Thabor, 75001 Paris, France

editorial_summary.overview: Posh rooms & suites in an upscale hotel offering a lobby library & meeting space.

formatted_address: 4 Rue du Mont Thabor, 75001 Paris, France
name: Renaissance Paris Vendome Hotel

reviews.text:
We had a mixed experience at this hotel. On the plus side, every staff member we encountered was friendly and helpful. The concierge went above and beyond by securing two restaurant reservations for us, and the location truly can’t be beat. The bar staff in the “speakeasy”-like bar was especially fantastic—professional and welcoming, and the atmosphere there was great.

However, the rooms left a lot to be desired. Ours was extremely small, with barely enough space for luggage or to move around the bed. The air conditioning didn’t function well and the room was often uncomfortably warm, especially on hot days. The towels and robes were frayed and overused, and the odd art above the bed felt more creepy than stylish. Both the rooms and bathrooms are desperately overdue for a renovation. The fitness center was also a big disappointment—it’s tucked into a dark, uninviting area of the building and felt completely neglected.

It definitely does not give 5-star vibes. With some serious updates to the facilities, this could be a much better hotel experience. For now, you're paying for location and service, but not comfort.

Great hotel. The location is great for tourists - it is walking distance from the Louvre, Musée D’Orsay, and also with many of the subway lines to get to the other parts of the city. Room was small (as would be expected for a megalopolis such as Paris) but functional and clean. The staff was always super helpful and welcoming. The one knock on the hotel was during our stay, one of the two elevators was out of service which meant a longer than usual wait to go up and down the hotel. Would definitely go back.

We are Marriott Bonvoy Silver members. My husband is paraplegic and we called and made reservations months in advance to make sure our accessible room with roll in shower was available.  They confirmed the availability and reservation for which we paid over 700€ a night. Upon arrival, our room was not available. They proposed a room that had a step into the shower. Not possible as my husband cannot walk. The next solution was to give us a room with roll in shower but “the AC was not working properly”. The truth is the AC was not working at all. We were offered a complimentary breakfast to compensate. We spent a horrible night with a small fan to give us air.
The next day they gave us our new room. Ac was working but the bathroom sink was clogged. We called to have them look at it and found that it was unclogged but still not draining properly. We found the toilet dirty and called maintenance to come back. He said that is the best he could do for the sink and upon unclogging, the toilet was backed up. He would send someone to come clean. No one from housekeeping ever came.
We went out for the evening and coming back, as my husband was brushing his teeth, the nastiness came back up in the sink. The handicap rooms are clearly not maintained or cleaned properly. There is mildew and crud in corners and there is a constant smell. The floors have marks from water damage.
This is supposed to be a 5 star hotel. We  chose Marriott, an American chain for its standards which have clearly not been respected. We are horrified at the treatment of handicap people and the lack of hygiene and customer service with our grievances.. This is discrimination at its finest. Stay away!

I had an excellent stay at this hotel with my 2 teenage daughters.

- location is simply perfect!! Couldn’t be any better!
- excellent service! Friendly and attentive staff. I had a request which required in room delivery and it was promptly brought to our room. This request was made via the Bonvoy App chat option. I also lost an item in my room and was able to go and get it back 2 days after. Very attentive service!
- As a Bonvoy Platinum, I got free breakfast , late check out and a nice touch from the hotel team (juice and macarons).
- Room might not be the biggest but it’s well decorated and appointed (nespresso machines, mini fridge, etc….) and was very well cleaned.
-Breakfast: Nothing amazing but still a good  buffet with selection of cold items and you can order eggs from chef station.

Overall I recommend this hotel!

My wife and I loved everything about our experience at this hotel.   While the rooms are small, they are very efficiently laid out.  The bed and pillows were comfortable and the air conditioner worked well.   For some reason, housekeeping did not make up the room each day, but if we needed something, the concierge would always make sure we got it.

As a Platinum Bonvoy member, my wife and I got complimentary breakfast and 10 euros off any other food or drink.  Breakfasts were excellent.   You could choose from the buffet or order off the menu or do both.   The food was very good.

The same restaurant also served lunch and dinner.   It has excellent service and the food is outstanding!   Renia is a terrific hostess....always happy to see you and very helpful along with all of the staff in the restaurant.

The concierges are terrific, too.   They will help you get anywhere and happy to take time to explain.

The hotel itself is centrally located.   You can walk to the Louvre, the Cathedral de Notre Dame, The Eiffel Tower, the Latin Quarter, The University de Sorbonne, and the Arc de Triomphe in less than 30 minutes.   The Metro can also take you anywhere you want to go.

Paris is a wonderful walking city and this hotel was a great find!
